reference_response: The claim for office visit for established patient with moderate complexity (CPT code 99214) with diagnosis I48.91: Unspecified atrial fibrillation was APPROVED because the procedure and diagnosis are covered under the policy, despite preauthorization being required.

"The claim for diagnostic colonoscopy including collection of specimens (CPT code 45378) with diagnosis K21.9 was DENIED because the procedure and diagnosis do not match the coverage details specified in the policy."

The claim for Complete blood count (CBC) with automated differential (CPT code 85025) with diagnosis F32.9: Major depressive disorder, single episode, unspecified (ICD code F32.9) was DENIED because the procedure is not covered under the specified policy details for this diagnosis and age/gender group.

The claim for Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads (CPT code 93000) with diagnosis I10: Essential (primary) hypertension was APPROVED because the procedure and diagnosis do not fall under the coverage details specified for the policy.

The claim for Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report (CPT code 93000) with diagnosis I20.0 was DENIED because the covered diagnoses for this procedure are J44.9: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, unspecified, and Grace Taylor has I20.0: Unstable angina.

The claim for Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report (CPT code 93000) with diagnosis E11.9 was APPROVED because the procedure is covered under the policy for patients with Type 2 diabetes mellitus without complications in the specified age range.

The claim for an office or outpatient visit for an established patient, typically 20-29 minutes (CPT code 99213) with diagnosis G43.909: Migraine, unspecified, not intractable, without status migrainosus was APPROVED because the preauthorization was obtained and the patient's age and gender match the policy coverage details.

The claim for Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report (CPT code 93000) with diagnosis J44.9 was APPROVED because preauthorization was obtained and the procedure is covered under the policy for males aged 39-75 with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, unspecified.

The claim for Collection of venous blood by venipuncture (CPT code 36415) with diagnosis G43.909 was APPROVED because preauthorization was obtained and the procedure is covered under the policy for the specified diagnosis.

The claim for Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report (CPT code 93000) with diagnosis G43.909: Migraine, unspecified, not intractable, without status migrainosus was APPROVED because it falls within the policy coverage details for age range and gender specified.
